original: Andersson, Sigurd Johan, apotekare, Göteborg, f. 18/7/82 i Grythytte s:n, Örebro 1., av apot. Johan Anders Wilhelm A. o. Emma Maria Albertina Svensson. G. 27 m. Gurli Paulsson. Barn: Gunnar f. 28, Bertil 33, Kerstin 35. — Stud:ex. i Örebro 01, farm. kand. 04, apot:ex. 11. Elev v. apot. Bävern i Sthlm 01-03, anst. där o. i Vaxholm 04-06, Skellefteå o. Umeå 07-09, Bergsjö, Gällivare o. Bävern i Sthlm 11-13, Örnen i Östersund 13-15, Gripen i Sundsvall 15-19, Örnen i Östersund 19-27, Ludvika 27-32, priv. å apot. i Edsbyn 32, transp. t. apot. En-hör ni ngen i Gbg 39. Kas,saförvailt. i nordsv. krets, av Sv. farm:förb. 20, ordf. 21-27 samt fullm. 20-27.
translated: Andersson, Sigurd Johan, pharmacist, Gothenburg, born July 18, 1882 in Grythytte parish, Örebro County, son of pharmacist Johan Anders Wilhelm A. and Emma Maria Albertina Svensson. Married to Gurli Paulsson on the 27th of a month (exact month not stated). Children: Gunnar born in 1928, Bertil in 1933, Kerstin in 1935. Completed the study of classical subjects at Örebro in 1901, earned a pharmacy degree in 1904, and a pharmaceutical license in 1911. Served as an apprentice at the pharmacy Bävern in Stockholm from 1901 to 1903, employed there and in Vaxholm from 1904 to 1906, then worked in Skellefteå and Umeå from 1907 to 1909, in addition to Bergsjö, Gällivare, and Bävern in Stockholm from 1911 to 1913, Örnen in Östersund from 1913 to 1915, Gripen in Sundsvall from 1915 to 1919, Örnen in Östersund from 1919 to 1927, Ludvika from 1927 to 1932, and as a private pharmacist in Edsbyn in 1932, before being transferred to the pharmacy En-hör ni ngen in Gothenburg in 1939. He was the treasurer of the northern Swedish district of the Swedish Pharmaceutical Society from 1920, serving as its chairman from 1921 to 1927 and as a representative from 1920 to 1927.
